quote:
Clear water flows over white rock,
the autumn moon shines bright,
so clear is the original face.
Who dares say it is or is not?
author: Son'gyong Sunim, Korean nun

quote:
The pillar pulls out the bone sideways,
the void shows its claws and fangs;
even if one profoundly understands,
there is still sand in the eye.
author: Nun Jiaoan (China, 11th cent. CE)

quote:
With this and that I tried to keep the bucket together,
and then the bottom fell out.
Where water does not collect,
the moon does not dwell.
author: Laywoman Chiyono (Japan, 13th cent. CE)

quote:
Up on the high slopes, I see only old woodcutters.
Everyone has the spirit of the knife and the axe.
How can they see the mountain flowers
reflected in the water—glorious, red?
author: Laywoman Chen (China, c. 600-800 CE)

quote: Greed, hatred and ignorance rise endlessly:  I vow to abandon them.
author: Second Bodhisattva Vow

quote: Sentient beings are numberless:  I vow to save them.
author: First Bodhisattva Vow

quote: Dharma gates are countless:  I vow to awake to them.
author: Third Bodhisattva Vow

quote: The Buddha way is uncontrived:  I vow to embody it fully.
author: Fourth Bodhisattva Vow

quote:
See and realize
that this world
is not permanent.
Neither late nor early flowers
will remain.
author: Ryokan

quote:
Great is the robe of liberation,
a formless field of benefaction.
Buddhas have authentically transmitted it.
Ancestors have intimately received it.
Beyond wide, beyond narrow,
beyond cloth, beyond threads,
maintain it thus,
then you are called a keeper of the robe.
author: Ryokan

quote:
If someone asks
about the mind of this monk:
say it is no more than
a passage of wind
in the vast sky.
author: Ryokan

quote:
Although from the beginning
I knew
the world is impermanent,
not a moment passes
when my sleeves are dry.
author: Ryokan

quote:
One thing
the thief left behind—
moon in my window.
author: Ryokan

quote:
Mountain forms are the Buddha's Body,
Valley streams are his Long Broad Tongue.
At night I hear their myriad hymns of praise—
How can I tell you what they say?
author: Su Tung-P'o

quote:
It is easy to come to some realization.

It is difficult to manifest that realization,
moment by moment.
author: Dae Gak

quote:
To study the Way
is to study the self.

To study the self
is to forget the self.

To forget the self is to be brought to life
by myriad things.
author: Dogen

quote:
Even though
I may see it again
how can I sleep tonight?
— autumn moon.
author: Dogen

quote: By the continuous practice of all buddhas and ancestors, your practice is actualized and your great road opens up.  By your continuous practice, the continuous practice of all buddhas is actualized and the great road of all buddhas opens up.  Your continuous practice creates the Circle of the Way.
author: Dogen

quote:
Vast and broad, it covers heaven and earth
Close and intimate, it contains the pure void
Buddhas and ancestors cannot find it
But they can build reed huts.
author: T'aego

quote: The self-nature of suchness gives rise to thoughts.  But even though the six sense-faculties see, hear, sense and know, it is not tainted by the myriads of images.  The true nature is constantly free and self-reliant.
author: Platform Sutra of the Sixth Patriarch

quote:
The water is clear right down to the bottom,
Fish swim lazily on.
The sky is vast without end,
Birds fly far in the distance.
author: Hongzhi Zhenjue

quote:
In darkness it is even brighter,
When hidden it is all the more visible.
The crane dreams of misty frost,
The waters contain the distant autumn.
author: Hongzhi Zhenjue

quote:
When the bottom is filled with rubbish,
Just walk through the sludge.
Do not laugh at the snail
Meandering in its own slime.
author: Hongzhi Zhenjue

quote: You must remember and return to the homeward path. The clouds evaporate in the cold sky.  The autumn has departed and the mountain is barren. This is where we originally dwell.
author: Hongzhi Zhenjue

quote: People of affairs who study the Path often understand rationally without getting to the reality.  Without discussion and thought they are at a loss, with no place to put their hands and feet—they won't believe that where there is no place to put one's hands and feet is really a good situation.
author: Ta-hui

quote: Though essence and function are distinguished, the profound clarity is one:  like when you cut up sandalwood, each and every piece is sandalwood.
author: Ta-hui

quote:
The hundred bones will crumble
And return to fire and wind.
But one thing is eternally clear,
embracing heaven and earth.
author: Chinul

quote:
The clear mirror and its stand have been broken.
There is no dust in the eyes of the blind donkey.
Dark, dark everywhere—the appearance of subtle Zen.
Let it be.
The garden lantern opens it mouth, laughing.
author: Muso Soseki

quote:
He who dances and skips on the Great Way
Is face to face with the Nirvana Gate.
Just sitting with a boundless mind,
Next year spring is still spring.
author: Chao-chou

quote:
Eighty years and eight,
No craving, no attachment.
Let's go on back home.
When the water clears, the moon appears.
author: Nun Tao-ch'ien (d. 1820)

quote:
I suddenly find myself upside-down on level ground:
When I pick myself up, there's nothing to say!
If someone should ask me what this is all about,
Smiling, I'd point to the pure breeze and bright moon.
author: Nun Chen-ju (12th century CE)

quote:
People have a one-scroll sutra
Without form and without name.
No one is able to unroll and read it,
And none of us can hear it.
When you are able to unroll and read it,
You enter the priciple and accord with the Birthless.
Not to speak of becoming a Bodhisattva,
You don't even need to become a Buddha.
author: Layman P'ang

quote:
One thousand feet my line hangs down.
The slightest wave is followed by ten thousand ripples.
The night is quiet, the water cold, the fish not biting.
My boat filled with an empty cargo of moonlight, I return.
author: Chuanzi Decheng (9th century CE)

quote: In the deep canyon where the clear stream is flowing continuously, all kinds of birds are signing everywhere.  No one ever comes to visit this place.  It is called Sunim's dwelling place, and it is quiet and tranquil.  Here is where I sit and examine what this mind is. Now if this mind is not Buddha, then what else is it?
author: Kyong Ho (1849-1912 CE)

quote:
A white-haired Zen monk with a hut for my home
the wind has torn my robe into rags
down by the stream I rake leaves for my stove
after a frost I wrap a mat around my orange tree
ultimate reality isn't created
ready-made koans aren't worth a thought
all day I sit by my open window
looking at mountains without lowering the shade
author: Shih Wu ('Stonehouse', 1272-1352 CE)

quote:
On the edge of a sword,
Over the ridge of an iceberg,
With no steps, no ladders,
Climbing the cliffs without hands.
author: Mumon ('Mumonkan', Case 32, 1228 CE)
